title: Using IDA pro decompiler in Ghidra
content: Is it possible to use IDA pro decompiler in Ghidra ? I know the opposite is possible.

answers_data.content:
The Hex-Rays decompiler heavily relies on IDA for disassembly and other analysis so itâ€™s unlikely it can be made to work without reimplementing (most of) IDA. Besides, it would be against the license.

You can, however, migrate your Ghidra project to IDA and then use the decompiler.
